# Government Tender Announcement
## Title:
Psychology Services for Correctional Service of Canada
## Reference Number:
21470-26-4321110
## Publication Date:
September 1, 2023

### Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number**: 21470-26-4321110
* **Amendment Number**: 4
* **Tender Closing Date**: September 18, 2023, at 2:00 PM ET
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: January 1, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: December 31, 2026
* **Contracting Entity**: Correctional Service of Canada

### Background Information
The Correctional Service of Canada require providers of Psychology Services for Peterborough Parole Officer to provide Aftercare Psychology Services.

### Requirements

* Providers will provide mental health and/or psychological assessment or psychological risk assessment services to offenders as requested by the Project Authority.
* Services will be provided as a Registered Psychologist in Ontario for a maximum of 160 hours per year.
* Treatment and counseling orientation will be cognitive-behavioral, evidence-based, and responsive to the special needs of women and Indigenous People.
* Services must be provided in compliance with federal and provincial legislation and standards.
* Providers will consult with the Project Authority to ensure that all psychological practices are consistent with the relevant legislation, practice standards, and policies.

### Evaluation Criteria

* The lowest price compliant bid will be used as the evaluation criterion.

### Procurement Method
This procurement is a competitive process, open to all interested suppliers.

### Contact Information

* Jill Emmons, Contracting Authority
* Phone: (613) 329-2694
* Email: [Jill.Emmons@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:Jill.Emmons@csc-scc.gc.ca)

### Notice to Bidders
Bidders can obtain the complete solicitation document and evaluation criteria by downloading the documents from the Canada Buys website. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
